Animals¶

class biosim.animals.Animal(weight=None, age=None)¶

Animal class used as a base for Herbivore and Carnivore sub-classes

Attributes
age

Property method for age

fitness

Property method for the fitness

weight

Property function for the Animal’s weight

Methods

add_age(self)

Updates the ‘_age’ variable in the class instance by one, also updates the fitness when age is updated.

compute_prob_birth(gamma, fitness, …)

Computes the probability of birth for the animal, using the equation

decrease_annual_weight(self)

Decreases weight by :math:`eta times the current weight.The function also updates the fitness of the animal instance by using the ‘update_fitness’ method..

decrease_birth_weight(self, child_weight)

Updates ‘_weight’ each time an animal class instance gives birth, by reducing the animal class instance’s birth by \(\zeta\) times the birth-giving animal’s weight.

determine_birth(self, nearby_animals)

Determines whether the animal is to give birth or not using the ‘compute_prob_birth’ function to gain a value.

determine_death(self)

Calculates the probability of death for the animal instance, uses that probability and Numpy’s random.choice function to return a bool value.

determine_to_move(self)

Calculates the probability to move, and then returns a bool value deciding whether animal is to move.

increase_eat_weight(self, fodder)

Increases the animal class instance’s weight by \(eta\) times the current weight of the instance.

update_fitness(self)

Updates the ‘self._fitness’ variable using ‘_calculate_fitness’ method

update_parameters(new_par_dict)

Updates the current parameters and also checks that no parameters are negative.
classmethod _calculate_fitness(weight, age)¶

Calculates the fitness by using the ‘_q_sigmoid’ function, uses the parameters from the class.

\[\begin{split}\Phi = \begin{cases} 0 & \text{for }w\le0\\ q^{+}(a, a_{\frac{1}{2}},\phi_{age}) \times q^{-}(w, w_{\frac{1}{2}},\phi_{weight}) & \text{else} \end{cases}\end{split}\]
Parameters
weight: int or float

Weight of the animal class instance

age: int

Age of the animal class instance

Returns
float

The new value of fitness using the _q_sigmoid function with different sign values \(+\), and \(-\)

classmethod _determine_sick()¶

Determines if the animal is to become sick, using the ‘p_sick’ parameter and Numpy’s random.choice method.

Returns
bool

True or False

classmethod _normal_weight()¶

Class method which returns the birth weight using a Gaussian distribution, where it gets the mean and standard deviation from the class parameters.

\[\text{w} \sim \cal{N}(\text{w}_{\text{birth}},\sigma_{ \text{birth}})\]

Where \(w_{birth}\) is the mean, and \(sigma_{birth}\) is the standard deviation.

Returns
start_weight = int or float

The birth weight value gotten from the normal distribution.

static _q_sigmoid(x, x_half, rate, signum)¶

This is the standard sigmoid function besides that the sign can be specified.

It is given by:

\[q^{\pm}(x, x_{\frac{1}{2}},\phi) = \frac{1}{1 + e^{\pm \phi (x - x_{\frac{1}{2})}}}\]
Parameters
x: int or float
x_half: int or float
rate: int or float
signum: +- 1
Returns
float

Sigmoid value given the inputs

add_age(self)¶

Updates the ‘_age’ variable in the class instance by one, also updates the fitness when age is updated.

property age¶

Property method for age

Returns
_age: int

The current age of the animal instance

static compute_prob_birth(gamma, fitness, nearby_animals)¶

Computes the probability of birth for the animal, using the equation

\[\text{min}(1, \gamma \times \Phi \times (N-1))\]
Parameters
gamma: int or float

Gamma parameter which is gotten from the animal class parameters. It is the probability factor for giving birth.

fitness: int or float

Fitness value for the animal instance

nearby_animals: int

How many animals of the same specie is in the same area as the animal.

Returns
float

The probability of giving birth.

decrease_annual_weight(self)¶

Decreases weight by :math:`eta times the current weight. The function also updates the fitness of the animal instance by using the ‘update_fitness’ method.

decrease_birth_weight(self, child_weight)¶

Updates ‘_weight’ each time an animal class instance gives birth, by reducing the animal class instance’s birth by \(\zeta\) times the birth-giving animal’s weight.

It also updates the fitness after the weight has been altered.

Parameters
child_weight: int or float

The weight of the new-born child.

determine_birth(self, nearby_animals)¶

Determines whether the animal is to give birth or not using the ‘compute_prob_birth’ function to gain a value. The function then uses numpy.random.choice to choose between True or False with fixed probabilities.

Parameters
nearby_animals: int

The amount of animals nearby in the same area (cell)

Returns
bool

True if the animal is to give birth, False if the animal is not to give birth.

determine_death(self)¶

Calculates the probability of death for the animal instance, uses that probability and Numpy’s random.choice function to return a bool value.

Returns
bool

Returns True if Animal instance is to die, and False if it is not to die

determine_to_move(self)¶

Calculates the probability to move, and then returns a bool value deciding whether animal is to move.

Returns
bool

Returns True if Animal is to move, or false if it is not to move

property fitness¶

Property method for the fitness

Returns
_fitness = float

The current fitness value of the animal instance

increase_eat_weight(self, fodder)¶

Increases the animal class instance’s weight by \(eta\) times the current weight of the instance. The function also updates the fitness of the animal class instance using ‘update_fitness’.

Parameters
fodder: int or float

Amount of food the animal instance is to eat.

param = {}¶
update_fitness(self)¶

Updates the ‘self._fitness’ variable using ‘_calculate_fitness’ method

classmethod update_parameters(new_par_dict)¶

Updates the current parameters and also checks that no parameters are negative.

Parameters
new_par_dict: Dictionary

New dictionary containing the new parameters which need to be updated.

property weight¶

Property function for the Animal’s weight

Returns
_weight: int or float

Returns the current weight of the animal instance

class biosim.animals.Carnivore(weight=None, age=None)¶

Carnivore is a subclass of Animal. Uses super method to inherit methods and specified attributes from Animal class.

Attributes
age

Property method for age

fitness

Property method for the fitness

weight

Property function for the Animal’s weight

Methods

add_age(self)

Updates the ‘_age’ variable in the class instance by one, also updates the fitness when age is updated.

compute_prob_birth(gamma, fitness, …)

Computes the probability of birth for the animal, using the equation

decrease_annual_weight(self)

Decreases weight by :math:`eta times the current weight.The function also updates the fitness of the animal instance by using the ‘update_fitness’ method..

decrease_birth_weight(self, child_weight)

Updates ‘_weight’ each time an animal class instance gives birth, by reducing the animal class instance’s birth by \(\zeta\) times the birth-giving animal’s weight.

determine_birth(self, nearby_animals)

Determines whether the animal is to give birth or not using the ‘compute_prob_birth’ function to gain a value.

determine_death(self)

Calculates the probability of death for the animal instance, uses that probability and Numpy’s random.choice function to return a bool value.

determine_kill(self, min_fit_herb)

Determine kill function which uses ‘_compute_kill_prob’ to calculate the probability and then uses Numpy’s random choice with fixed probability to determine if the carnivore is to kill the chosen herbivore.

determine_to_move(self)

Calculates the probability to move, and then returns a bool value deciding whether animal is to move.

increase_eat_weight(self, fodder)

Increases the animal class instance’s weight by \(eta\) times the current weight of the instance.

update_fitness(self)

Updates the ‘self._fitness’ variable using ‘_calculate_fitness’ method

update_parameters(new_par_dict)

Updates the current parameters and also checks that no parameters are negative.
static _compute_kill_prob(fit_carn, fit_herb, delta_phi_max)¶

Computes probability of a Carnivore killing Herbivore which is determined through:

\[\begin{split}p = \begin{cases} 0 & \text{if }\Phi_{carn}\le \Phi_{herb}\\ \frac{\Phi_{carn} - \Phi_{herb}}{\Delta\Phi_{max}} & \text{if } 0 \le \Phi_{carn} - \Phi_{herb} \le \Delta\Phi_{max}\\ 1 & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}\end{split}\]
Parameters
fit_carn: int or float

Fitness of the Carnivore which is the predator

fit_herb: int or float

Fitness of the Herbivore which is the prey

delta_phi_max: int or float

Parameter for Carnivore

Returns
float or int

The probability of the carnivore killing the herbivore

determine_kill(self, min_fit_herb)¶

Determine kill function which uses ‘_compute_kill_prob’ to calculate the probability and then uses Numpy’s random choice with fixed probability to determine if the carnivore is to kill the chosen herbivore.

Parameters
min_fit_herb: int or float

Fitness of the herbivore which is to be preyed upon by the carnivore.

Returns
bool

Returns true or false determining whether the carnivore is to kill the herbivore or not

param = {'DeltaPhiMax': 10.0, 'F': 50.0, 'a_half': 60.0, 'beta': 0.75, 'eta': 0.125, 'gamma': 0.8, 'lambda': 1.0, 'loss_rate': 0.8, 'mu': 0.4, 'omega': 0.9, 'p_sick': 0, 'phi_age': 0.4, 'phi_weight': 0.4, 'sigma_birth': 1.0, 'w_birth': 6.0, 'w_half': 4.0, 'xi': 1.1, 'zeta': 3.5}¶
